meanings.definition: To separate grain from (a plant) by beating
meanings.sent1: The farmer threshes the wheat to separate the seeds from the stalks.
meanings.sent2: She threshes the rice to remove the husks before cooking.
meanings.sent3: The energetic toddler threshes the pillows on the bed, pretending they are wheat.
meanings.sent4: The storm threshes the trees, shaking loose the leaves like grains of wheat.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the flail as it threshes the wheat fills the barn.

meanings.sent1: The drummer threshes the drums with great enthusiasm during the performance.
meanings.sent2: He threshes the dough to make it smooth and elastic for baking.
meanings.sent3: The angry chef threshes the meat with a mallet to tenderize it before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The waves thresh against the shore, relentless in their pounding.
meanings.sent5: The boxer threshes his opponent with a series of quick punches.
